result.execSummary:
The defendant Darius Cortez Sims was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done.  Collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wage.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
-Restitution set at zero.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant does qualify for the  Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving four (4) years Initial Confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes:
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.
Seek and maintain full time employment. Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes:
Submit a DNA sample if not already done.  
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darius Cortez Sims in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Darius Cortez Sims in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 8 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 5 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 4 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Sentencing Hearing on Thursday, February 25, 2016 at 1:30 PM in BR 26, CH Rm 634 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.
filed.
Received and filed.

On the same day, at the hour of 4:36 pm, the jury returned and by their foreperson, Patricia W., brought in a verdict as follows:

"We, the jury, find the defendant, Darius Sims, GUILTY of Possession of a Firearm by a felon, in the manner and form as charged in Count 1 of the Information.  Dated this 14th day of January, 2016.  Patty W., Foreperson."

On direction of the Court, deputy clerk polled the jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  Verdict received and filed.  Court discharged the jury.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for acquittal.    The state wants to ensure defendant is charged as a "repeater".  No objection from defense, enhancer is charged on the complaint.   The "repeater" enhancer remains.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Filed, Exhibit List, Jury Instructions and jury questions.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  PSI ordered without recommendation.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darius Cortez Sims in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Darius Cortez Sims in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 1:36 pm.  Continued sworn testimony for defense:  Raven C.  Exhibit # 9 offered and received.  Jury out of box at 1:55 pm.  Jury in box at 2:09 pm.   State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.    Jury retired at the hour of 3:02 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Fox and Harrison who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Darius Cortez Sims in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Darius Cortez Sims in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juror #6 not present, he called and is on his way.  Juror #6 arrived late and discharged from this case.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 8:49 am.  Continued sworn testimony for state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Anthony Milone.  Exhibit # 30 offered and received.   Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Detective Craig Thimm. Jury out of box 9:56 am.  Jury in box at 10:24 am.  Exhibit # 20, 18, 19 offered and received.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Chad Boyack,   Milwaukee Police Investigator Kerri Schott.   Exhibits # 10, 21, 11  offered and received.  Sworn for the state: Crime Lab Analyst Brittany Paulson,  Exhibit # 12, 17 offered and received.  Jury out of box at 11:47 am.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box at 11:52 am.  Sworn for defense: Raven C.  Jury out of box at 12:00 pm.  Court recessed for lunch.

Defendant Darius Cortez Sims in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Darius Cortez Sims in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Jury in box at 1:43 pm.  Juror #7 did not report to jury management after lunch and is not present.  Voir dire continued.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Jury our of box at 2:49 pm for break.  Jury in box at 3:21 pm.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.   Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Anthony Milone. Exhibits #1, 2, 3-7, 8, 15, 16 offered and received.  Exhibits # 1,  2, 3-7,  published to the jury.  Jury out of box at 4:38 pm.  Court recessed for the day.  The Court received a call from Jury Management, Juror #6 in their office with a concern about the case.  Juror #6 in box at 4:53 pm.  Juror #6 out of box at 4:56 pm.  Discussion by parties.  Juror #6 in box at 4:58 pm.  Juror #6 out of box at 5:00 pm.  Case adjourned for jury trial on January 14, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.  Jury trial scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darius Cortez Sims in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Darius Cortez Sims in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case passed: Defense counsel's witness is not present.
Case recalled: Defense counsel's witness now present, same appearances.  The state's offer is revoked now that case is proceeding to trial.  

Jury panel in court at 10:58 am.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 11:08 am.  Jury out of box at 11:45 am.  Court recessed for lunch.

Defendant Darius Cortez Sims in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Darius Cortez Sims in custody.  
Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pretrial.  Hearing proceeded.  Parties still in contest posture; matter remains calendared for Jury Trial on 1-13-16 at 9:00 a.m. before Branch 26.
filed.

/requested jury instructions/motion in limine, filed by the State.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Darius Cortez Sims not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter remains in trial posture, matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 9/30/15 at 9:30am in Br. 35.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Darius Cortez Sims not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial on 9.9.15 and for jury trial on 9.30.15.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 09-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Darius Cortez Sims not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 07-21-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darius Cortez Sims in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Darius Cortez Sims in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.    Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #12CF4881 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Chad Boyack-MPD Officer.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Darius Cortez Sims in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Darius Cortez Sims in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
